item.title: Google Chrome's AI-powered security feature rolls out to everyone
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google Chrome has updated the existing "Enhanced protection" feature with AI to offer "real-time" protection against dangerous websites, downloads and extensions. [...]

item.title: New FinalDraft malware abuses Outlook mail service for stealthy comms
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new malware called FinalDraft has been using Outlook email drafts for command-and-control communication in attacks against a ministry in a South American country. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Hackers steal emails in device code phishing attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An active campaign from a threat actor potentially linked to Russia is targeting Microsoft 365 accounts of individuals at organizations of interest using device code phishing. [...]

item.title: Hackers exploit authentication bypass in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers are launching attacks against Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS firewalls by exploiting a recently fixed vulnerability (CVE-2025-0108) that allows bypassing authentication. [...]

item.title: SonicWall firewall bug leveraged in attacks after PoC exploit release
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Attackers are now targeting an authentication bypass vulnerability affecting SonicWall firewalls shortly after the release of proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit code. [...]

item.title: PirateFi game on Steam caught installing password-stealing malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A free-to-play game named PirateFi in the Steam store has been distributing the Vidar infostealing malware to unsuspecting users. [...]

item.title: PostgreSQL flaw exploited as zero-day in BeyondTrust breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Rapid7's vulnerability research team says attackers exploited a PostgreSQL security flaw as a zero-day to breach the network of privileged access management company BeyondTrust in December. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers breach more US telecoms via unpatched Cisco routers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: China's Salt Typhoon hackers are still actively targeting telecoms worldwide and have breached more U.S. telecommunications providers via unpatched Cisco IOS XE network devices. [...]

item.title: Microsoft fixes bug causing Windows Server 2025 boot errors
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has fixed a known issue causing "boot device inaccessible" errors during startup on some Windows Server 2025 systems using iSCSI. [...]

item.title: whoAMI attacks give hackers code execution on Amazon EC2 instances
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Security researchers discovered a name confusion attack that allows access to an Amazon Web Services account to anyone that publishes an Amazon Machine Image (AMI) with a specific name. [...]
